body.p: At the present term of the Mason Circuit Court, G. H. Wilkinson was fined and imprisoned six months for cutting in a sudden affray, and without malice, a man named Hall, A petition has been sent you to remit the pimprisonment, He had previous to his conviction been confined for about four months, and since conviction has been in prison near a month, He is not a bad man, and has an and dependant family, who are suffering for want of his assistance, I hope you will send him a pardon so far as the remainder of his pun-imprisonment may be released,

If we had known of the law passed by the late legislature, giving
jury the right to fine or imprison, I do not believe the jury would have found a verdict of imprisonment
